objects.name: Analytic 1069
objects.description: Detects rogue Wi-Fi access points broadcasting the same SSID as legitimate APs with stronger signal strength, unexpected MAC/BSSID values, or inconsistent encryption settings. Correlates authentication attempts, captive portal redirections, and anomalous traffic flows through unauthorized APs.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: WLANLogs:Association
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Multiple APs advertising the same SSID but with different BSSID/MAC or encryption type

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Probe responses from unauthorized APs responding to client probe requests

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: networkdevice:syslog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Failed authentication requests redirected to non-standard portals

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Baseline of authorized SSIDs; deviations may indicate rogue AP.
Whitelist of BSSID/MAC addresses mapped to corporate SSIDs.
Used to flag unusually strong signals from unexpected APs.
Trusted login domains; unrecognized portals may be malicious.
